result.execSummary:
The defendant David I Mayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY  for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 136 days (5-02-2015 to 05-07-2015, 06-05-2015 to 10-12-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant may not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.

01-22-16/ Judge Carolina M Stark
Court made decision as defendant is NO LONGER ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNGEMENT for reasons placed onthe record.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Fine is set at ZERO.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 12 months of probation.

timeConds.notes:
01-22-16/ Judge Carolina M Stark
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant to serve all 130 days of the condition time, without Good Time credit, release only for Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments, with a strong objection to electronic monitoring, FORTHWITH.
Per CR-245 correction to clerical error on 10-12-15 Sentencing entry, defendant's release privileges ONLY for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.

Without good time credit; release ONLY  for The Day Reporting Center work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing on 01-22-2016 at 1:30pm, branch 17.

records.addlTxt:
Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Stark Br 17 for review. os
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 130 days of condition time, non-eligibility for expungement and clerical error correction, CR-245, release ONLY for DRC and inmate work assignments (not work).

Defendant David I Mayfield in court, in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Revocation Summary report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve all 130 days of the condition time; without good time credit, release only for Day Reporting Center and immate work assignments, with a strong objection to electronic monitioring; forthwith. Court made decision as defendant is no longer eligible for expungement for reasons placed on the record.

The following clerical error was made in teh Judgment of Conviction:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 130 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY  for The Day Reporting Center work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing on 01-22-2016 at 1:30pm, branch 17.  
CORRECTION:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 130 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing on 01-22-2016 at 1:30pm, branch 17.

Order signed and filed. tk
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Revocation Hearing received and filed. tk

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 1 YEAR  in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY  for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 136 days (5-02-2015 to 05-07-2015, 06-05-2015 to 10-12-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 12 months of probation.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 130 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY  for The Day Reporting Center work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing on 01-22-201 at 1:30pm, branch 17.  
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED  the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation, without any violations of probation. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant David I Mayfield in custody.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
- ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
- Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant David I Mayfield in custody. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court sets cash bail at $750.00 with turn over to justice point.  Case remains scheduled for projected plea on 10-12-2015 at 1:30pm, branch 17.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case not on today's calendar. Case called as defendant is in court for jury trial with 15CF2348. Court takes no action on this matter and will be scheduled on for status with jury trial case on 09-30-2015 at 8:30 am. Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 10-12-2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from the State received and filed.
State's Objection to Defense Untimely Notice of Alibi and Alternatively, State's Witness List in Potential Rebuttal to Defense Notice of Alibi, filed.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Court in jury trial on another matter.   Court notes no objection to case being transferred to another Court, if approved by Court. For reasons presented to the Court, case adjourned for project plea hearing on 10-12-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant David I Mayfield not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for scheduling conference. Court notes no objection to case defendant's other cases being transferred to Branch 17 or this case being transferred to another court for global resolution, if approved by Court. Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 08-10-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17  Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-22-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant David I Mayfield in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.  Defendant is requesting preliminary hearing as to this case.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective Andrew Farina.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding Case #13CM003717 that are attached to the complaint.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to  Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant David I Mayfield not in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant David I Mayfield in custody.  Nicholas Cerwin for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is removed from the bull pen and returned to the jail, due to his behavior.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant David I Mayfield in custody.  Joanne Hardtke for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to time defense attorney appeared, case cannot be commenced in a timely manner.    Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Defendant David I Mayfield in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant David I Mayfield in custody.  
William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
